course.title: Enhancing Social Media Privacy Settings
course.summary: This module provides a guided walkthrough for adjusting privacy settings on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. It covers configuring who can see personal information, posts, and location data, as well as setting up two-factor authentication for extra protection.

course.title: Phishing Awareness And Email Security
course.summary: This intervention focuses on identifying phishing emails, recognizing suspicious links, and understanding how to verify sender authenticity. It may involve reviewing real-life examples and practicing safe email behaviors such as avoiding clicking on unverified links.

course.title: Privacy Settings on Popular Apps
course.summary: The session covers how to adjust privacy and security settings within popular applications (like messaging apps, photo-sharing services, and online marketplaces). It explains how to manage permissions, control data sharing, and limit exposure of personal information.

course.title: Detecting Spyware Infection on Devices
course.summary: This module teaches how to recognize signs of spyware—such as unusual battery drain, unexpected pop-ups, or slow performance—and how to run free diagnostic tools like Windows Defender or Malwarebytes. Participants learn to scan their devices, interpret the results, and take immediate actions to remove any threats.

course.title: 2FA Setup And Mangement
course.summary: The session guides participants through setting up two-factor authentication (2FA) across various platforms, including banking, email, and social media. It covers using authenticator apps, SMS codes, and backup methods for account recovery.

course.title: Password Management And Security
course.summary: Participants learn best practices for creating strong, unique passwords and using password managers. The module covers common mistakes like password reuse and offers techniques for generating memorable yet secure passwords.

course.title: Managing Digital Footprint
course.summary: Participants learn strategies to minimize the digital traces they leave behind, such as regularly cleaning up social media profiles, using privacy-focused search engines, and being cautious about what they share online.

course.title: Recognizing AI-Assisted Manipulation And Deepfakes
course.summary: This session explains the basics of AI-generated media, such as deepfakes and manipulated images. It teaches participants to look for subtle discrepancies (in lighting, movement, or audio quality) and introduces tools for verifying content authenticity.

course.title: Using VPNs for Secure Browsing
course.summary: This module explains what a VPN is, how it encrypts internet traffic, and the benefits of masking your IP address. It includes guidance on choosing reputable VPN services and setting them up on various devices.

course.title: Safe Use of Public Computers and Wi-Fi
course.summary: This session covers best practices for using public computers and networks, including how to avoid leaving personal data behind, using portable security software, and recognizing the risks of unsecured Wi-Fi.

course.title: Identifying Hidden-Surveilance Devices
course.summary: This intervention covers the use of inexpensive RF detectors, smartphone apps, and network scanning tools to detect hidden cameras and microphones. It explains the science behind electronic transmissions, how to perform an electronic scan, and the practical limitations of these tools.

course.title: Safe Online Banking Practices
course.summary: This module teaches the fundamentals of secure online banking, including how to recognize secure websites (https), use strong passwords, and monitor account activity regularly. It might also include tips on avoiding public Wi-Fi when accessing banking services.

course.title: Recognizing Malicious Mobile Apps
course.summary: This intervention focuses on identifying suspicious apps through their permissions, developer reputation, and user reviews. It guides participants on verifying apps in official stores and understanding warning signs of malicious behavior.

course.title: Verifying Online Identities and Combating Catfishing
course.summary: Participants learn techniques like reverse image searches, cross-checking profile details across platforms, and identifying red flags in communication. The module may include hands-on exercises with popular social media and dating apps to recognize inconsistencies and verify identity.

course.title: Securing Home Wi-Fi Networks
course.summary: Participants learn how to change default router settings, set strong Wi-Fi passwords, update firmware, and disable remote management features. This session includes demonstrations of router interfaces and tips for regular maintenance.
